text:
For example, consider a firm with a LIFO reserve of $150 that faces a tax rate of 40%.
To convert the balance sheet to FIFO, increase inventory by $150, decrease cash by $60
($150 x 40%), and increase stockholders' equity (retained earnings) by $90 [$150 x (1 -
40%)]. This will bring the accounting equation back into balance. The net effect of the
adjustments is an increase in assets and shareholders' equity of $90, which is equal to the
LIFO reserve net of tax.
